sn21.3:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn21.3:4.3: At that time Venerables Sāriputta and Moggallāna were staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn21.3:4.4: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of solitude, went to Venerable Moggallāna,
sn21.3:4.6: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Sāriputta sat down to one side,
sn21.3:5.1: “Reverend Moggallāna, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
sn21.3:5.2: Have you spent the day in a peaceful meditation?”
sn21.3:5.3: “Reverend, I’ve spent the day in a coarse meditation.
sn21.3:5.4: But I have had some Dharma talk.”
sn21.3:5.5: “Who did you have a Dharma talk with?”
sn21.3:5.7: “But Reverend, the Buddha is far away. He’s staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn21.3:5.8: Did you go to him with your psychic powers,
sn21.3:5.9: or did he come to you?”
sn21.3:5.10: “No reverend, I didn’t go to him with my psychic powers,
sn21.3:5.11: nor did he come to me.
sn21.3:5.12: Rather, the Buddha cleared his clairvoyance and clairaudience towards me,
sn21.3:5.13: and I cleared my clairvoyance and clairaudience towards him.”
sn21.3:5.14: “But what manner of Dharma talk did you have together?”
sn21.3:6.1: “Well, reverend, I said to the Buddha:
sn21.3:6.2: ‘Sir, they speak of one who is energetic.
sn21.3:6.3: How is an energetic person defined?’
sn21.3:6.4: When I said this, the Buddha said:
sn21.3:6.5: ‘Moggallāna, it’s when a mendicant lives with energy roused up:
sn21.3:6.6: “Willingly, let only skin, sinews, and bones remain! Let the flesh and blood waste away in my body! I will not stop trying until I have achieved what is possible by manly strength, energy, and vigor.”
sn21.3:6.7: That’s how a person is energetic.’
sn21.3:6.8: That’s the Dharma talk I had together with the Buddha.”
sn21.3:7.1: “Reverend, next to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna I’m like a few pieces of gravel next to the Himalayas, the king of mountains.
sn21.3:7.3: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna is so mighty and powerful he could, if he wished, live on for the eon.”
sn21.3:8.1: “Reverend, next to Venerable Sāriputta I’m like a few grains of salt next to a mound of salt.
sn21.3:8.3: Venerable Sāriputta has been commended, complimented, and praised by the Buddha:
sn21.3:9.3: any mendicant who has gone beyond
sn21.3:10.1: And so these two spiritual giants agreed with each others’ well spoken words.
